title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When performing certain actions in the java editor, such as closing and reopening a file, the operation completes quickly. However, when selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes significantly longer (around 15 seconds) to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The 'Revert' operation in the java editor should complete at a similar speed to the close and reopen actions. It should not take significantly longer to replace the contents of the window with the original when selecting 'Revert'.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Open an editor on the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository. 
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty. 
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab. 
4) When prompted with the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, select 'no'. 
5) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 
6) Repeat steps 1) and 2). 
7) From the pop-up menu in the editor, select 'Revert' and observe that it takes around 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
